title: What makes the study of economics enjoyable? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would recommend that economics can be a lot of fun if you like working through and discovering why people make decisions. There is a lot more nuance to it but the most general principal is "follow the money" (or other incentives) and you will know why people did something otherwise explainable, this is the premise and exploration of the two Freakonomics - The hidden side of everything books. Joy for one person might be terrifying for another.  So if you want to study economics and you enjoy “problem solving” and untangling complexities then economics would fit that bill.  But, you had better be prepared for a challenge and a  lot of quantitative analysis along with some fairly dry reading materials.  Economists typically need advanced degrees to make them more employable since it is not a typical common job title outside of higher education and teaching.
